title: Weezer - Songs from the Black Hole [FINAL]
description:
Weezer - Songs from the Black Hole

An interpretation by Kyle K - Chitown, IL, USA

--------------------------------------------------------------

All tracks written and performed by Weezer/Rivers Cuomo except where noted

   
   1. "Countdown" - [0:53]
   2. "Blast Off!" - [1:58]
   3. "Who You Callin' Bitch?" - [0:44]
   4. "Oh Jonas"* - [0:27]
   5. "I Do" - [1:56]
   6. "Come to my Pod" - [1:29]
   7. "Oh No, This Is Not for Me" - [0:45]
   8. "Tired of Sex" - [2:54]
   9. "She's Had a Girl"* - [0:46]
  10. "Dude, We're Finally Landing (Good News!)" - [0:51]
  11. "I Don't Want Your Lovin'" - [3:02]
  12. "Getchoo" - [2:49]
  13. "I Just Threw Out the Love of My Dreams" - [2:40]
  14. "Superfriend" - [3:16]
  15. "Superfriend (Reprise)" - [0:27]
  16. "O Lisa" - [2:31]
  17. "You Won't Get Me Tonight" - [3:26]
  18. "Why Bother?" - [2:00]
  19. "Waiting on You" - [3:55]
  20. "No Other One" - [2:44]
  21. "Devotion" - [3:05]
  22. "Purification of Water" - [3:55]
  23. "Longtime Sunshine" - [3:06]
  24. "Longtime Sunshine (Reprise)"* - [1:13]


*Covers not performed by Weezer

"Oh Jonas" by Aaron Hansen: www.aaronhansen.com/
"She's Had a Girl" by ofrankd:
"Longtime Sunshine (Reprise)" by VonRitcher:

Album Artwork by Kylevh: http://www.sftbh.com/page.php?id=pics

--------------------------------------------------------------

It's no lie that Weezer's Songs from the Black Hole is probably the greatest lost album hardly anyone has ever heard, and it will remain that way unless Weezer frontman Rivers Cuomo decides to do something about it. Well, I decided I wasn't patient enough to wait for him, so I took matters into my own hands to edit and compile what I think could've been a realistic take on this album. 

Since many pivotal recordings remain unreleased, I took some liberties in a few places, using some of Rivers' demos that weren't necessarily associated with SFTBH, as well as some later Weezer material, Pinkerton tracks, B-sides, and a few covers I managed to find on the internet.  I tried my best to flesh out the album wherever I could, and I also tried my best to combined both track listings from the original SFTBH demos to recreate the plot that Rivers had intended. I think it works surprisingly well.

To top it all off, I've also edited the songs so that they flow seamlessly into each other, since that's another thing Rivers originally had in mind. I think it's one of the coolest aspects of this album, and it definitely helps you hear just how amazing this project was going to be. Trust me, it was (and hopefully still is) going to be amazing. And as long as Rivers Cuomo is still alive and kicking, so will the greatest space rock opera the world has never heard.


By the way, everything here is copyrighted to Weezer. If you have enjoyed this album, I highly encourage you to pick up some Weezer records if you don't already own them. The same goes for Rivers Cuomo's solo demo compilation "Alone: The Home Recordings of Rivers Cuomo", which has helped shed a lot of light on the mystery and mystique of SFTBH. 

Enjoy this album, and KEEP THE ROCK!
